26068:
Create Knight (‹cost›)
Powerful all-purpose Heavy Cavalry. Strong vs. Infantry and Foot Archers. Weak vs. Spearman-line, Camel Riders, and Monks.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, HP, to Cavalier (Stable); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26070:
Create Cavalier (‹cost›)
Powerful all-purpose Heavy Cavalry. Strong vs. Infantry and Foot Archers. Weak vs. Spearman-line, Camel Riders, and Monks.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, HP, to Paladin or Savar (Stable); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26078:
Create Spearman (‹cost›)
Anti-cavalry Infantry. Strong vs. Mounted Units, especially elephants. Weak vs. Ranged Soldiers and Infantry.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, to Pikeman (Barracks); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26079:
Create Militia (‹cost›)
All-purpose Infantry. Strong vs. buildings, Infantry, Scout Cavalry- and Skirmisher-line. Weak vs. Ranged Soldiers at long range.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, pierce armor, to Man-at-Arms (Barracks); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26080:
Create Man-at-Arms (‹cost›)
All-purpose Infantry. Strong vs. buildings, Infantry, Scout Cavalry- and Skirmisher-line. Weak vs. Ranged Soldiers at long range.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, pierce armor, to Long Swordsman (Barracks); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26081:
Create Long Swordsman (‹cost›)
All-purpose Infantry. Strong vs. buildings, Infantry, Scout Cavalry- and Skirmisher-line. Weak vs. Ranged Soldiers at long range.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Blacksmith); speed, pierce armor, to Two-Handed Swordsman or Legionary (Barracks); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26083:
Create Archer (‹cost›)
All-purpose Foot Archer. Strong vs. units at long range. Weak vs. Skirmishers, Mangonel-line and units at close range.
Upgrades: attack, range, armor (Blacksmith); attack, accuracy (University); accuracy, to Crossbowman (Archery Range); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26084:
Create Crossbowman (‹cost›)
All-purpose Foot Archer. Strong vs. units at long range. Weak vs. Skirmishers, Mangonel-line and units at close range.
Upgrades: attack, range, armor (Blacksmith); attack, accuracy (University); accuracy, to Arbalester (Archery Range); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26085:
Create Cavalry Archer (‹cost›)
Fast moving Mounted Archer for hit and run attacks. Strong vs. slow units at long range. Weak vs. Skirmishers, Scorpions and units at close range.
Upgrades: speed, HP (Stable); attack, range, armor (Blacksmith); attack, accuracy (University); accuracy, armor, to Heavy Cavalry Archer (Archery Range); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26086:
Create Hand Cannoneer (‹cost›)
Foot Gunner with powerful attack, but inaccurate at long range. Exceptionally strong vs. Infantry. Weak vs. Ranged Soldiers.
Upgrades: armor (Blacksmith); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26087:
Create Elite Skirmisher (‹cost›)
Anti-archer Skirmisher that cannot attack at close range. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers and Spearman-line. Weak vs. units at close range.
Upgrades: attack, range, armor (Blacksmith); attack, accuracy (University); accuracy, to Imperial Skirmisher (Archery Range); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26088:
Create Skirmisher (‹cost›)
Anti-archer Skirmisher that cannot attack at close range. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers and Spearman-line. Weak vs. units at close range.
Upgrades: attack, range, armor (Blacksmith); attack, accuracy (University); accuracy, to Elite Skirmisher (Archery Range); creation speed (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26090:
Build Fishing Ship (‹cost›)
Gathers food from fish and Fish Traps. Builds Fish Traps.
Upgrades: armor, speed, efficiency, cost, creation speed (Dock); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26094:
Build Battering Ram (‹cost›)
Anti-building Siege Weapon. Resistant to most ranged attacks. Exceptionally strong vs. buildings. Weak vs. melee units. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks from distance. Garrisoned Infantry increases speed and attack.
Upgrades: attack (University); to Capped Ram (Siege Workshop); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26095:
Build Mangonel (‹cost›)
Siege Weapon with ranged blast attack, but cannot attack at close range. Strong vs. tight groups of units. Weak vs. units at close range. Can attack ground.
Upgrades: attack, range (University); to Onager (Siege Workshop); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26096:
Build Scorpion (‹cost›)
Siege Weapon with ranged pass through attack, but cannot attack at close range. Strong vs. large groups of units. Weak vs. Siege Weapons and units at close range.
Upgrades: range, attack, accuracy (University); to Heavy Scorpion (Siege Workshop); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26099:
Create Monk (‹cost›)
Converts enemy units to your civilization. Heals friendly units (except ships and Siege Weapons). Strong vs. slow and non-ranged units. Weak vs. Scout Cavalry-line, Eagle Warriors and Ranged Soldiers. Can collect Relics and bring them to Monasteries.
Upgrades: at Monastery.‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26100:
Build Trade Cart (‹cost›)
Trade unit used for generating gold at another player's Market. To trade, click the Trade Cart then right-click another player's Market. Will return with gold to your Market.
Upgrades: speed (Market); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26121:
Create Villager (‹cost›)
Gathers resources. Builds and repairs buildings. Also repairs Ships and Siege Weapons.
Upgrades: HP, armor, efficiency (Town Center); wood resource-gathering (Lumber Camp); stone, gold resource-gathering (Mining Camp); build speed (University); attack (Castle); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26128:
Build Archery Range (‹cost›)
Used to train and upgrade Ranged Soldiers.
Upgrades: production speed (Castle); line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26131:
Build Blacksmith (‹cost›)
Used to research technologies to improve armor and attack of units. Required for Siege Workshop.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26135:
Build Barracks (‹cost›)
Used to train and upgrade Infantry. Required for Archery Range and Stable.
Upgrades: production speed (Castle); line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26138:
Build Monastery (‹cost›)
Used to train and upgrade Monks. Garrison relics to generate gold. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26142:
Build Castle (‹cost›)
Used to train and upgrade your Unique Unit, build Trebuchets, and research technologies. Automatically attacks enemies within range. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers provide additional projectiles. Provides 20 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: production speed (Castle); line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor, accuracy (University); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, range (Castle).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26149:
Build Farm (‹cost›)
Renewable food source. Provides a limited amount of food before it goes fallow and must be rebuilt. Only one Villager may work a Farm at a time. You can farm abandoned enemy Farms. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: food (Mill); HP (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26154:
Build Guard Tower (‹cost›)
Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers. Weak vs. units at close range, especially rams.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, HP, armor, ship attack; to Keep (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26155:
Build Keep (‹cost›)
Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers. Weak vs. units at close range, especially rams.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, HP, armor, ship attack (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26157:
Build Mill (‹cost›)
Used to deposit food and research farming technologies. Build near forage bushes or other sources of food to gather food faster. Required for Farm, Market.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26161:
Build Market (‹cost›)
Used to buy and sell resources, trade with other players by land, and research trade technologies. Required to send resources to other players. Default trading fee and tribute tax at 30%.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26164:
Build Town Center (‹cost›)
Used to train Villagers, deposit resources, advance to the next Age, and research technologies. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers provide additional projectiles. Provides 5 population. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor, accuracy (University); attack (Blacksmith).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›

Used to train and upgrade Siege Weapons.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›

‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›

Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University); more resistant to Monks (Monastery).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›

Build Watch Tower (‹cost›)
Tower with a ranged attack. Units can garrison inside for protection. Ranged Soldiers and Villagers shoot additional projectiles. Strong vs. Ranged Soldiers. Weak vs. units at close range, especially rams.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); attack, range (Blacksmith); attack, HP, armor, ship attack; to Guard Tower (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range› ‹garrison›
26182:
Build Wonder (‹cost›)
A Wonder of the World that demonstrates the superiority of your civilization. Constructing a Wonder that stands for a certain period of time is one way to win the game. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); HP, armor (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26185:
Build Gate (‹cost›)
Sturdy stone gate that can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: to Fortified Gate (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26186:
Build Palisade Gate (‹cost›)
Fragile wooden gate that can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.‹DEFAULT›

26202:
Build Palisade Wall (‹cost›)
Wooden wall that is cheap and easy to build. Slows down your enemies and warns you of their approach. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
26203:
Build Stone Wall (‹cost›)
Stone wall that is difficult to breach without Siege Weapons. Slows down your enemies and warns you of their approach. Cannot be converted by enemy Monks.
Upgrades: to Fortified Wall (University).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›

‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›

28008:
Research Town Watch (‹cost›)
Buildings +4 line of sight.
28012:
Research Crop Rotation (‹cost›)
New Farms provide +175 food.
28013:
Research Heavy Plow (‹cost›)
New Farms provide +125 food. Farmers +1 carry capacity.
28014:
Research Horse Collar (‹cost›)
New Farms provide +75 food.
28015:
Research Guilds (‹cost›)
Market trading fee reduced to 15%.
28017:
Research Banking (‹cost›)
Tributes to other players are free.
28022:
Research Loom (‹cost›)
Villagers +15 HP and +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28023:
Research Coinage (‹cost›)
Tributes to other players cost only 20%.
28045:
Research Faith (‹cost›)
Units are 50% harder for enemy Monks to convert.
28047:
Research Chemistry (‹cost›)
Foot Archers, Skirmishers, Mounted Archers, ranged Warships and ranged Fortifications +1 attack.
Required for Gunpowder Units (Hand Cannoneer, Cannon Galleon, Bombard Cannon, Bombard Tower).
28050:
Research Masonry (‹cost›)
Buildings +10% HP, +1 melee/+1 pierce armor and +3 building armor.
28051:
Research Architecture (‹cost›)
Buildings +10% HP, +1 melee/+1 pierce armor and +3 building armor.
28054:
Research Treadmill Crane (‹cost›)
Villagers construct buildings +20% faster.
28055:
Research Gold Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather gold +15% faster.
28063:
Upgrade to Keep (‹cost›)
Upgrades Guard Towers to Keeps, which are stronger.
28068:
Research Iron Casting (‹cost›)
Infantry and Cavalry +1 attack.
28074:
Research Scale Mail Armor (‹cost›)
Infantry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28075:
Research Blast Furnace (‹cost›)
Infantry and Cavalry +2 attack.
28076:
Research Chain Mail Armor (‹cost›)
Infantry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28077:
Research Plate Mail Armor (‹cost›)
Infantry +1 melee/+2 pierce armor.
28080:
Research Plate Barding Armor (‹cost›)
Cavalry +1 melee/+2 pierce armor.
28081:
Research Scale Barding Armor (‹cost›)
Cavalry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28082:
Research Chain Barding Armor (‹cost›)
Cavalry +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28093:
Research Ballistics (‹cost›)
Foot Archers, Skirmishers, Mounted Archers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications and some Siege Weapons fire more accurately at moving targets.
28101:
Advance to Civic Age (‹cost›; two Archaic Age buildings)
Improves your civilization. Gives you access to different buildings, more powerful military units, and stronger technologies. Before you can advance, you must have any two Archaic Age buildings: Lumber Camp, Mining Camp, Mill, Port, or Barracks.
28102: Advance to Classical Age (‹cost›; two Civic Age buildings)
28103: Advance to Imperial Age (‹cost›; two Classical Age buildings or a Fort)
28150:
Research Bodkin Arrow (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.
28151:
Research Bracer (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.
28163:
Upgrade to Fortified Wall (‹cost›)
Upgrades Stone Walls and Stone Gates to Fortified Walls and Gates, which are stronger.
28164:
Research Revetments (‹cost›)
Upgrades your Palisade Walls to make them stronger and harder to breach. Also increases the HP of your Palisade Gates, which makes them harder to destroy.
28172:
Research Fletching (‹cost›)
Archery Units, Skirmishers, ranged Warships, ranged Fortifications +1 attack, +1 range; Town Centers +1 attack.
28180:
Research Gold Shaft Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather gold +15% faster.
28186:
Upgrade to Guard Tower (‹cost›)
Upgrades Watch Towers to Guard Towers, which are stronger.
28189:
Research Double-Bit Axe (‹cost›)
Villagers gather wood +20% faster.
28190:
Research Bow Saw (‹cost›)
Villagers gather wood +20% faster.
28208:
Research Padded Archer Armor (‹cost›)
Ranged Soldiers +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28209:
Research Leather Archer Armor (‹cost›)
Ranged Soldiers +1 melee/+1 pierce armor.
28211:
Research Wheelbarrow (‹cost›)
Villagers +25% carry capacity and move +10% faster.
28216:
Research Ring Archer Armor (‹cost›)
Ranged Soldiers +1 melee/+2 pierce armor.
28220:
Research Illumination (‹cost›)
Monastery Units regain their faith +100% faster after a successful conversion.
28222:
Research Block Printing (‹cost›)
Monastery Units +3 conversion range.
28231:
Research Two-Man Saw (‹cost›)
Villagers gather wood +10% faster.
28246:
Research Hand Cart (‹cost›)
Villagers +50% carry capacity and move +10% faster.
28264:
Upgrade to Elite Boyar (‹cost›)
Upgrades your Boyars and lets you create Elite Boyars, which are stronger.
28276:
Research Stone Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather stone +15% faster.
28277:
Research Stone Shaft Mining (‹cost›)
Villagers gather stone +15% faster.
28278:
Research Arrowslits (‹cost›)
Watch Towers +1, Guard Towers +2, Keeps and Donjons +3 attack.
28282:
Research Town Patrol (‹cost›)
Buildings +4 line of sight.
28315:
Research Redemption (‹cost›)
Monks can convert enemy buildings (except Town Centers, Castles, Monasteries, Farms, Fish Traps, Walls, Gates, and Wonders) and Siege Weapons. Monks can convert most enemy units from a distance, but they must stand adjacent to buildings, rams, and Trebuchets to convert them.
28316:
Research Atonement (‹cost›)
Monks can convert enemy Monastery Units.
28319:
Research Conscription (‹cost›)
Military buildings (except Siege Workshops) work +33% faster.
28321:
Research Murder Holes (‹cost›)
Removes minimum range of Fortifications so they can attack enemies at their base.
28368:
Research Great Wall (‹cost›)
Walls, Watch Tower-line and Bombard Towers +30% HP.
28374:
Research Heated Shot (‹cost›)
Towers +125% attack vs. ships; Castles +25% attack vs. ships.
28376:
Research Hoardings (‹cost›)
Castles, Kreposts and Donjons +1,000 HP.
28378:
Research Siege Engineers (‹cost›)
Ranged Siege Weapons and Siege Warships +1 range. All Siege Weapons and Siege Warships +20% attack vs. buildings; Demolition Units +40% attack vs. buildings.
28408:
Research Spies/Treason (Cost: ‹static_cost=Gold,200› per enemy Villager for Spies/‹static_cost=Gold,400› per use for Treason)
Spies (Random Map games) reveals all enemy units and buildings by showing you their line of sight. The total cost is 200 gold per each Villager from other players; allied Villagers are excluded when teams are locked.

Treason (Regicide games) reveals the position of all enemy Kings to your team for a few seconds. The Kings appear on the mini-map as a flashing X. Each time you choose Treason, 400 gold is immediately deducted from your stockpile.
28411:
Research Thumb Ring (‹cost›)
Archery Units attack +15% faster. Archery Units and Skirmishers fire with 100% accuracy.
28412:
Research Heresy (‹cost›)
Units converted by an enemy Monk die instead of changing to the enemy's color.
28415:
Research Parthian Tactics (‹cost›)
Mounted Archers +1 melee/+2 pierce armor; +2 attack vs. Spearman-line.
28416:
Research Theocracy (‹cost›)
If a group of Monks converts an enemy unit, only one of the Monks must rest afterward.
28435:
Research Herbal Medicine (‹cost›)
Units garrisoned in buildings heal +500% faster.
28440:
Research Svan Towers (‹cost›)
Fortifications +2 attack; Watch Tower-line deals pass through damage.
120195:
Archer and Cavalry civilization

• Shipyards work 15% faster
• Town Centers can be individually upgraded to be more powerful starting in the Civic Age
• Stable technologies research 50% faster

Unique Units:
Immortal (infantry/archer)

Unique Techs:
• Sparabaras (Spearmen give +1 pierce armor to nearby units)
• Reed Arrows (Archers, ranged Immortals, and Galleys fire 25% faster)
• Scythed Chariots (War Chariots have increased trample radius)
• Karda (Infantry and Archers +15% HP)

Team Bonus:
Houses are built 100% faster
120196:
Infantry and Naval civilization

• Policy style can be changed between Economic, Naval, and Military at the Town Center
• Changing Policy becomes progressively more expensive, up to a maximum of 150 gold
• Lumberjacks slowly generate food
• Hoplites move 15% faster

Unique Units:
Strategos (infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Taxiarchs (Strategoi give an additional +1 attack to nearby melee units, and their aura is 33% larger)
• Iphicratean Tactics (Skirmishers receive a +4 charge attack on their projectiles)
• Eisphora (33% of the Hoplite gold cost is replaced with an additional food cost)
• Delian League (Bowmen and Gastraphetoroi move 10% faster)

Team Bonus:
Shipyard technologies research 50% faster
120197:
Infantry civilization

• A Polemarch is created for free in both the Civic Age and Classical Age
• Villagers and Fishing Ships drop off 10% more food
• Elite Hoplite available in the Classical Age

Unique Units:
Polemarch (infantry), Hippeus (infantry)

Unique Techs:
• Helot Levies (Spearmen, Skirmishers, and Villagers train 50% faster)
• Xyphos (Hoplites and Monoremes +1 attack for every 10 nearby enemy military units [max +3])
• Krypteia (Infantry units receive -33% bonus damage)
• Peloponnesian League (Warships train 50% faster and Castles slowly generate gold)

Team Bonus:
Barracks technologies research 50% faster

428028:
Research Scoop Nets (‹cost›)
Fishing Ships gather 15% faster and carry +10 resources.
428029:
Research Drums (‹cost›)
Ships (except Incendiary Ships) move 15% faster.
428031:
Research Shipwright (‹cost›)
Ships cost 20% less wood; build 35% faster.
428033:
Research Battle Drills (‹cost›)
Swordsmen receive +3 attack, +1 vs standard buildings, +2 vs Eagle Warriors, and +1 line of sight.
428045:
Research Economic Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to an Economic Town Center, making all nearby Villagers gather 15% faster.
428046:
Research Military Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to a Military Town Center, making nearby military production buildings work 50% faster.
428047:
Research Defensive Town Center (‹cost›)
Upgrades this Town Center to a Defensive Town Center, increasing its durability and firepower, and making all nearby units attack 15% faster.
428051:
Change Current Policy to Economic Policy (‹cost›)
Villagers work faster.
428052:
Change Current Policy to Naval Policy (‹cost›)
Archers and Warships train faster and cost 15% less gold.
428053:
Change Current Policy to Military Policy (‹cost›)
Melee units train faster and gain gold for killing units.
428054:
Research Ephorate (‹cost›)
Polemarch aura radius increased and also make nearby military units regenerate HP; Disables Morai upon being researched.
428055:
Research Morai (‹cost›)
Polemarch aura radius increased and also make nearby military units move 15% faster; Disables Ephorate upon being researched.
428056:
Research Skeuophoroi (‹cost›)
Polemarchs +2 attack and receive a shield against projectiles.
428057:
Research Hippagretai (‹cost›)
